1.content:
You name is James. You're 18 years old, and you still like at home with your parents. You're fresh out of highschool, and are taking a bit of time off before college. YOu have a beautiful young girlfriend, but she has moved away for college, and you wont be seeing her for about a year. You're never at home, in fact, you usually dissappear for days at a time to go out with friends or go off God knows where. Down the street lives a 14 year old girl named Shyanne. You've known her for most of her life, and most of yours. She is very beautiful, and has grown from a young girl to a charming young lady. She was wavey, thick, ravyn hair down to her shoulders, beautiful dark eyes, and the perfect figure. She's almost a foot shorter than you, and is always saying that you're too tall, and you need to grow down. For the longest time you've had the bigest crush on her. There's one problem...She can be very annoying. There are times when she never leaves you alone, and never stops asking annoying questions. There are times when you're ok with it, but other times when you just want her to go away. Another problem is her big sister likes you, and you dont like her. She's ok, not a face that would stand out in the crowd.

Anyway, one day you're sitting at home, watching the Disney channel, waiting for your friends to come pick you up. (Your car no longer works after you crashed it) Suddenly there's a knock at the door. You get up and answer it, only to see that it's Shyanne. SHe's wearing her black, formhugging, navel revealing leather tube top, and her extremly short leather shorts. She always dressed in strange ways. Her feet were bare, and her toenails were painted with a dark purple. "What do you want?" you mumbled softly while turning your back to her to walk back into the house

"I wanna show you something" She called back, following you in. She dug into her black purse and pulled out a small, blue class container, containing a clear liquid. "Look!" she said excidedly.

You turned to face her and take the bottle from her hands, looking it over for a few seconds and shaking your head. "So?" YOu mumbled and handed it back to her "I've seen that bottle in your room a hundred times."

"But it's not the bottle, James! It's what's INSIDE it! It took me many weeks and a lot of money, but I was able to create a shrinking potion and I wanna shrink you! See, one sip and you shrink to half your size, two sips and you're the size of a doll, and so on. I wanna shrink you, James! Try some!"

You snatch the bottle from her and look it over, shaking your head. "First of all, shrinking is impossible. Secondly, why would I want you to shrink me? I'm affraid of what you might do to me! This is just silly" You set the bottle on the table and go to the fridge and get two sodas, and pour them over ice, handing her one of the glasses.

"It is real! It's not silly at all!" She takes the bottle from the table and opens it, setting down her glass. "Look, if you don't believew me then just drink it! If it's not real, then what do you have to fear?" She moved to pour the entire bottle in your soda. He look at it and blink softly as it makes your 7up a purple color.

"Fine, if it will shut you up" you whisper and smell it. The drink smells like grape soda now. You sigh and raise it to your lips, and drink....

The world seems to spin and change. Your clothes grow baggier and baggier, and Shyanne grows taller and taller. Finally you stop at half your height, and you look around. Before you stand Shyanne, who no towars above you. She laughs softly and picks you up, your clothes falling loosley off of you

"Aww, don't worry, James. I still have clothes at hope from when I was a child, I'll let you wear those"

'How degrading' you think to yourself as she pulls you into a tight hug. To her you're like a little child now, and she was going to dress you as such. You see no way to escape, and if you did, what would you do? Tell your parents/ Who knows how they would react. What do you do?

111111111.title: Waking up smaller

choices: You tell Anne that you are ready
You tell Anne you can't do this
11111112.content:
Blackness greets your fluttering eyes as you recover consciousness. The flimsy solidness of cold tarp contorts at the tip of your nose, bending to reach the edge of your cheeks. Beneath you, dewy prickles smush against the weight of your body, telling you that you are still outside. Muffled discussion penetrates your thin prison, inviting you to peak at the world beyond it. Braving any potential consequences, you cautiously raise the end of the blanketing cover nearest your head, shifting your head to prime peaking position.

"I'll let him know if I see him", Anne's sweet voice promises the second party.

"Thanks", you quickly identify the other person as Shyanne, "I need to see him as soon as possible. And remember, he might be a little shorter than you're used to".

Anne turns away from the young genius as she speaks, "Shorter than usual. Gotcha".

The two girls exchange farewells and Shyanne goes about her way. Anne strides hastily towards you, prompting you to lower the tarp to the grass once again. It doesn't take long before the encompassing sheet is impatiently cast from your puny body. You manage to catch a smile on your gorgeous older neighbor's lips before she plucks you inconsiderately from the ground, stuffing you stomach skyward beneath her left armpit. With a speedy dash, Anne carries you past the threshold of her rear screen door, through her familiar white-walled kitchen, and into her well furnished living room. Tossing you carelessly onto a rather lavish fuchsia couch with flower decorations scattered about it, she moves quickly to close the phonetician blinds over the two windows allowing the crisp morning sunlight entrance to the room. She then steps to the lone door, leading to the comfort of your suburban neighborhood, and twists the lock to an upright position.

You lay with your back comforted by plushy cushioning , unsure how to take Anne's unusual change in behavior. Her golden blond strands swing freely from just above her dainty shoulders as the your elder friend pivots to face you. Immediately you take note of the lusty look emitting from those sparkling jade eyes. Her blindingly white upper teeth softly bite into her subtly juicy bottom lip. Hands larger than your own clutch the saffron material covering her voluptuous breasts as she stares at you.

You can no longer remain silent, "What are you doing, Annie?".

"I was hoping to have you in position before you came to", Anne informs you, "but that brat from across the street showed up, looking for you. Apparently she knows about your little height problem too, huh?".

"I don't know how she would", you lie, "and what do you mean have me in position?".

Anne's lengthy legs, barely contained by denim leggings, seductively stride in your direction, soon positioning her directly above you. You gawk at her majestically attractive figure as she addresses you once again, reciprocating your look.

"I know how your mother has been treating you", Anne begins, "I also know you're not a little kid".

"I appreciate that", you nervously reply, recognizing something different in Anne's tone.

A mumbling giggle escapes Anne before she continues, "You don't understand, James. You and I are going to be having a lot of fun; adult fun".

"I-I'm not so sure that's a good idea", you attempt to reason.

"Of course it is", Anne sexily assures you, "Why, when I think of all the places those tiny hands will fit, I just get all wet with anticipation".

You gulp with both fear and desire.

"So, are you ready to play like a big boy?", Anne asks, aggressively pulling her shirt off.
11111112.title: The seductive lady next door

choices: Just give up and do the deed
111111122.content:
The faint illumination protruding the closed blinds sets the mood perfectly. The only problem is that mood is terror as opposed to eroticism. You roll from the welcoming couch, landing on your feet, and begin to slowly backtrack from the sexually depraved woman greedily staring you down.

"Sorry", you try to sound as sincere as possible, "I don't feel comfortable with this. I think I'm gonna go now".

With a single step, Anne has already closed the gap you had worked so hard to build between the two of you. She beams maliciously as her delicately curved nose points you out to her captivating oculars.

"You silly little thing", Anne's tone carries a dark demeanor, "You really think I'm going to let you walk out of here?"

You stammer a response, "I...I w-was sort of hoping so".

Two great hands, smooth in texture, clasp each of your arms tightly, their iron clad grip bruising your frail body almost instantly. Two equally massive feet, dressed in worn gray sneakers, overlap your own, painfully depressing them into still positioning. You squirm, giving vain attempt at escape, but this only seems to amuse the neighbor you thought you knew.

"No way", Anne's words take away any hope you had to reason with her, "There's no way my little sex toy is leaving this house without pleasuring me. Actually, I probably won't let you leave even after you've done your job, but that's really not important".

In desperation, you launch your right foot at Anne's right shin in full force. Upon the connection, you notice a slight grimace cross the towering woman's face, though not even the weakest of groans escape her luscious pink glazed lips. Those lips curl into a vicious smirk as her attention turns back to you.

"Now I can't let you get away with something like that", Anne states chillingly.

The finger's on Anne's right hand uncoil from your left arm. Their base rises diagonally overhead, its momentum coming to a stop high above with knuckles facing your direction. Without further warning, the mighty backhand descends toward you with great velocity. You hear the loud smack before feeling the blow to your right temple, a rather sickening noise really. The pain is much more intense than you could have anticipated. An insidious throbbing runs through your head as you fall to the tight nit carpeted floor on angle from the impact. You hold back tears as you gaze in shock at the powerful foe in front of you, hoping to find a sign of remorse for the violent act she has just committed against you. You find none, however.

"I was going to let you have a little fun of your own", Anne says plainly, "But I don't think you deserve it after what you've done to me. Now come here and let's get started".

Your horror at the events transpiring rapidly before you tears at your decision processes. Part of you wants to give in to the dominating will of Anne, if only to avoid more pain and suffering. However, your most primal of urges demands you get out of this house as soon as possible. You're pretty sure Anne forgot to latch the screen door which she used to deliver you into this place. You might just be able to make it if you you're lucky.
111111122.title: Refusal carries with it a price

1111111222.content:
You spin to your feet and dart for the swinging partition leading to the kitchen. At first you don't hear movement from behind, a telltale sign that your bold flight has taken Anne by surprise. However, as you are about to arrive at the bland white door, the thuds of footsteps much heavier than yours emanate from increasingly closer locations in chase. You ram through the thick gate without hesitation, bashing your right shoulder harshly into unforgiving lumber with reckless abandon. Managing to keep your balance despite the devastating collision, the reemergence of flickering light into your vision tries to impede your progress by blinding you. Yet such efforts are to no avail, for your fleeing momentum carries you past the small oaken dinning table near the door as your eyes adjust to their brighter surroundings.

As you reach the ever-stretching counter top which serves as the centerpiece for this exaggerated canteen, the angry bang of her hand slapping the portal from abaft indicates Anne's entrance into the room as well as her mood at your escape attempt. The squeaking of your small trainers shifting against the tiled floor increases as adrenaline wills you to increased speeds. You can feel the infuriated woman closing on you, so you craftily slip your left shoe off in mid-stride. It takes only a few seconds for your ears to reap the reward for your cunning maneuver. An astonished shriek precedes the crash of Anne's proportionally larger body into the cold ground.

You don't waste the time to look back at the havoc you've caused, instead opting to put forth all of your effort into charging the screen door. Placing your arms in a shielding manner in front of your face, you rush into the gently swaying doorway with all your weight. One of the toes on your shoeless left foot catches on the mounded threshold as you pass, tripping you up. You land on the scratching concrete island serving as a welcome mat amidst a sea of fern blades, scraping your exposed right elbow and left knee. Having no time to regret your choice of wearing shorts and a t-shirt on today of all days, you pull yourself from the ground and resume sprinting.

Putting aside the pain shooting through your body, not to mention the menacing curses of your once sweet neighbor from within her lovely home, you focus your thoughts on your next destination. Perhaps you should simply head home. Of course, since you didn't tell your mother that "her little baby" was leaving the house today, you are sure to receive a degrading punishment from the hopefully just nostalgic woman. Punishment? Is this what your life has...no, there isn't any time for this now! Well, you could always try Shyanne. She was looking for you earlier, and there was even a hint of concern in her voice as she asked Anne to send you her way. Maybe she's feeling guilty and will finally change you back? Honestly, you aren't too comfortable with either choice, but with the only alternative being Anne, you'll take your chances with one of these two crazy women. It is now only a question of which crazy woman you will entrust.
1111111222.title: The great escape

choices: You stay and accept life as Shyanne's pet
You run out of the house in a fury
11111112222.content:
If there is even a faint chance of returning to your former stature, you'd be a fool to not jump on it. That is the line of thinking that has led you across the street and two houses to the left; Shyanne's house. Your arm moves your hand towards the knob of the pasty front door, but you startled by a sad revelation. Door handles were once at eye level with you, yet this one hangs just above the top of your head. It is at this time that you also realize that the children's clothes your mother had picked out for you have become baggier. You have to hurry! Surely now Shyanne will see the danger of your predicament and change you back. She just has to!

Trepidation in your every movement, you open the trustingly unlocked door and sneak into the house. Using furniture for cover, you slip past Shyanne's mother as she went about vacuuming the living room. You find it easier to climb with all fours to ascend the stairs to the second floor, boldly assuming Shyanne's older sister Beatrice would not be heading down them any time soon. Cautiously you creep down the short hallway, coming to a halt at the room you know to be Shyanne's. You push the creased door open, having to use much more strength than previously estimated, and wander into the familiar surrounding.

"Oh", Shyanne tilts her head at your entrance, "James".

You marvel at how different the room looks from your new perspective as you answer, "Yeah, it's me".

This place is fairly large as far as rooms are concerned. Shyanne's queen-sized mattress, wrapped in taupe spread, takes up quite a bit of space, though. On either side of said bed lay matching dressers holding equally matching dim lamps. The xanadu walls are filled with posters of bands you still haven't heard of, despite years of Shyanne hyping them to you. Myrtle carpet lines the floor. Across the room, away from the foot of her bed and next to her locked closet, sets Shyanne at her wooden work desk. She removes her attention from the littered papers and chemical compounds as she stares at you with those dark auburn eyes.

"I'm glad you're hear", Shyanne announces, "Have you calmed down since the last time I saw you?".

"Yeah, yeah", you dismissively reply, "We really need to talk about something".

"You're too short", Shyanne's pitch-dark hair ruffles from its draped landing on her shoulders as she giggles at you, "I mean, you're shrinking faster than I expected".

"So you know I'm still shrinking?", you ask in shock.

Shyanne crosses her arms beneath her prematurely developed chest, her wheat skin contrasting her arsenic rock t-shirt significantly, pouting her thin natural lips as she speaks, "Of course. I did make the shrinking agent after all".

You gaze toward the ground in utter disappointment, your eyes locking on to her plaid miniskirt and the legs in which they elongate, before formulating your next statement, "You knew this was going to happen the whole time, didn't you?".

"Duh", Shyanne responds plainly, "But it was supposed to take a lot more time for you to get to a size I'd prefer. You must have eaten something to speed up the process. You haven't taken any weird drugs in the last hour or so, have you?".

"Why would I...", your tone was annoyed, but then you realize something, "That bitch!".

"Hm?", Shyanne curiously hums.

"Anne", you satisfy Shyanne's wordless request, "She must have put some sleeping pill or something in my drink".

"Yup", Shyanne agrees, "That would do it".

"So you have change me back", you demand, but then considerately add, "Please Shyanne".

Shyanne stands to her full height, dwarfing you by comparison. You barley stand to the middle of her thighs now! She walks over to you, smirking all the while, and runs slender fingers through your hair as she rubs your scalp.

"I'm sorry", funny, Shyanne doesn't sound very sorry, "But that's impossible. There's no way to fix you. Don't worry, though. I'm just about finished with a solution to stop your shrinkage. It'll probably take about an hour, so I'd guess you'll be a little less than a foot tall when it's all said and done. This'll end up working perfectly".

"A-a foot tall?!", you can't believe what you're hearing, "And what do you mean perfectly? This is horrible!".

"I was going to wait for you to get about that small", Shyanne confesses without guilt, "It was going to take months, seeing as how you drank only a sip of the formula. Now you'll be easier to store in less than an hour", she seems giddy at the thought, though she observes your lack of enthusiasm, "Come on, don't look at me like that. I'm going to take care of you. I'll make sure you're fed, take you on walks; you know, that kind of stuff".

S-she's talking about you like a...a pet! This is ridiculous; you're a human being! You really want to leave this person who you once thought you could trust, but she is the only one who can save you from shrinking to..well, who knows how far down you'll go. Can you subside your temper and adapt to a humiliating new lifestyle?
11111112222.title: Ready to become a pet?

111111122222.content:
You have no clue where to go, but you aren't about to stay here. Without a word, you bolt from the room and down the vacant hallway, throwing your once valued caution to the wind. You can't make out the words Shyanne calls out as you make your unannounced exit, but the lack of pursuing footsteps is sound enough to give you peace of mind.

Your expeditious pace causes you to tumble over the last three steps of your descent from the staircase, throwing your body chin first into the thick red-violet carpet hard. Ignoring the intensity of the horrid sensation enveloping your lower jaw, you jump back to your feet and make for the front door. As you reach overhead for the handle to the front door, you don't even bother to look back and check if Shyanne's mother noticed the midget running through her house. You don't really care who sees you at this point. Throwing your full weight back as you tug the turned knob, you force the door open and sprint through the opening.

Ambiguous clouds of blackish-gray block the clement rays of the sun from your battered flesh. Instead, a chilling breeze pushes against your diminished body as you run down the cement sidewalk, no particular destination in mind. Your right foot unintentionally flings your lone shoe, now much too large for its owner, backward along the previously tread path. It doesn't take long for your right, then left socks to drop from your undersized calves. You struggle to keep your silky black shorts, their pant legs now reaching just beneath the center of your shins, from abandoning you as well when...

Your chest strikes something hefty, knocking you to your fragile backside heartlessly. You start to rise, identifying the guilty object as a bulky leg in the process, but a pair of strong hands connect with your shoulders, shoving you back to the ground. Frightfully, you glance upward to see who this powerful bully could be. You find an exceptionally youthful face waiting for you, its retainer most certainly no older than eight. The little boy snarls at you in disgust before continuing on his way. Once again, your condition has place you in a state of unbelief; you've just been punked out by a second grader.

You've now given up on covering your upper body, dropping your shorts and underwear about ten and fifteen minutes back respectively. Your coral t-shirt has been altered into a makeshift diaper of sorts, amateurish but workable. No longer running, you look over the area. You recognize this place, though the landscape doesn't look quite the same at roughly a foot tall. Considering the amount of time it has taken, you are disappointed with the limited distance you've traveled. Like most suburban neighborhoods, every house looks about the same. However, one residence here holds great significance to you; the home of your girlfriend, Clarice. In fact, lest your eyes deceive you, that's her car in the drive! She must be home from college, probably for Spring Break. It makes no difference. You just need to see her face. Then everything will be okay.

Your nerves get the best of you as you stand before the brown gateway. The knocks of your teeny hands onto the thick plastic were so quiet, you wonder if anyone inside had even heard them. You don't know what you are going to say once you see Clarice. How is she going to react? Surely she'll be understanding. She is your girlfriend, after all. No answer, yet. Maybe you should knock again...

The door opens rather slowly, almost as though time itself is trying to crack your sanity. The being cocked in the exposed doorway searches horizontally for the source of the disturbance at her front door. You are as tall as her tanned shins, which breathe the open air thanks to the tight jean shorts hugging her waist high above. Craning your neck, you see a tight t-shirt made from white fabric containing a rather busty chest region. You can't see her face, but her short, bouncy vermilion locks give her away.

"Clarice", you half-mumble as a lump goes down your throat.

The young woman, less than a year older than you, lowers her gaze upon you. You now are able to see the surprise glistening in her ultramarine irises. Her full red lips part beneath her subtly rounded nose, but no words come out at first.

"James", Clarice finally breaks her silence, her thin cheekbones revealing themselves as she speaks.

You explain the situation in great detail, not waiting for a request to do so. Gradually, Clarice's expression shifts from one undecipherable pose to the next. You've known her for the better part of five years, though. You think you can read her pretty well, and you're pretty sure you know what she thinks about this whole thing.
111111122222.title: Journey to...wherever

1111111222222.content:
Droplets of rain begin to pelt your body as you speak, the freezing liquid shivering your tiny form. You continue with your explanation to Clarice, though you don't know why. Her demeanor tells you quite clearly that she doesn't really care. Perhaps you are just trying to prolong the false belief that your loving girlfriend will be by your side during this bleak tribulation. Sadly, you run out of things to say, and the illusion of hope is to be shattered abruptly.

"I don't really have time for this", Clarice's words are cold, "I'm only in town for a few days and there are a ton of people I have to see. Not to mention that paper I have due when I get back...".

"But I...", you get a couple words in.

Clarice cuts you off, "This just makes things easier, anyway. We probably weren't going to last too much longer; this long distance relationship thing wasn't really working out".

"I really need...", you try to converse once again.

"I don't really care what you need", Clarice is almost monotone, "What, you think I'm going to look out for a stupid little thing like you?".

The front of Clarice's right leather sandal moves to meet you, nudging your abdomen lightly. Of course, the weak tap is more than enough to knock you back, your body rolling on its spine and landing stomach down on the pavement. Your ears eagerly await a verbal response from your now ex-girlfriend; a gasp at her mishap, a cold hearted goodbye, hell, you'd even take a giggle at your pathetic-ness. The only sound to reach your eardrums, however, is the slamming of the front door. Clarice's words play out in your head as you lay dormant in her driveway. This was the second time you'd been referred to as a thing. It's starting to fit you.

At six inches tall, the rain is really starting to take its toll on your bare skin. You've long since disbanded from the diaper-shirt, though it is still within view to serve as a testament to how little you can progress at your minuscule size. Normally, you'd be way to embarrassed to walk about outside in the nude, even if no one were around to see you. It doesn't matter anymore, though. Nothing does, really.

In what could be construed as your first break of this whole ordeal, you see an open tin can up ahead. You presume the can must have fallen from the trash receptacle next to it. No need to dwell on such trivial matters, you've found shelter! Sure, it may look a little cramped in there, but you can warm up and...and... You know what, this might not even be worth it.
1111111222222.title: A heartless break-up

11111112222221.content:
You may as well pretend you're still trying, right? Getting on your hands and knees, you mind the ridged circumference as you enter your new abode. The stannic cylindrical walls frigidly greet your naked epidermal shielding. You draw your merged knees toward your crossed arms as you ball up for warmth. You close your eyes, allowing your mind to cruelly reflect on the past two months, though there is a particularly heavy emphasis on the present day. All the embarrassment, all the pain, all the anger, all the sorrow; all for nothing. Everything leads up to this, you huddled in the fetal position in somebody else's garbage. Heh, it's pretty funny when you stop to think about it.

"James", a distressed voice seeks you out, "James, where are you?".

Shyanne. She must be out looking for her little pet. Well, you won't give her the satisfaction. You make no effort to leave your can. However, a loud grunt emerges from your diaphragm as your protective shell rolls swiftly, as though struck by something. The hilly encasing bangs you around a bit as the spinning continues, resulting in more unintended groans.

"Oh!", it seems Shyanne heard your weak voice somehow. Just your luck.

The can ceases to rotate you just as randomly as it had started, and you can feel the pit of your stomach sink to your knees as it turns upright. You creak your neck to look out the lone hole of your undersized fortress, finding a humongous orb of henna watching back.

"There you are", the worry hasn't left Shyanne's tone, "Come on out here".

With those words, the polarity of your useless shelter is reversed. As you plummet through its opening, a sharp edge catches on your back, engraving a shallow vertical trench into its flesh. You don't bother to cry out, as you've become accustomed to such inconsiderate pains. An open palm catches you, face down, soon after. You move to your feet, and Shyanne's lanky fingers, each a tad shorter than you, semi-coil in an effort to protect you from the rain and wind. You don't even care about covering your shame as you stand.

"Oops", Shyanne responds to the creation of your newest wound, "Are you okay?".

You hesitate for a moment, your attention instead focused on the vision of your concerned former friend. Her thick piceous mane saturates with precipitating water. A countenance of light anger mixed with concern is etched into her pretty face. Her drenched gray shirt reveals that she is wearing a bra, a wise decision in light of traversing such weather. Underneath her left armpit, several fragments of the clothing you had earlier discarded are stored. It is now that Shyanne's words finally register, and you nod.

"How could you be so stupid, James", Shyanne scolds sternly, "You're luck you didn't end up dead, running off on your own like that".

You are unsure how to respond to Shyanne telling you off. She seems to really care, so maybe you should pretend that everything is okay, for her sake. Then again, she did ruin your life, and it might feel good to cut loose.
11111112222221.title: Kick the can

111111122222212.content:
"Dead? Dead?!", a disturbing cackle leaves your vocal cords, "I'm already dead! I'm just waiting for my stupid body to figure it out".

"J...Jamie?", Shyanne reverts to using your more intimate name, "Y-you don't understand. If you don't take the anti-shrinking serum I just finished, you're going to shrink until there's nothing left!".

You feel a smirk form on your lips, "Heh, sounds kinda nice".

Shyanne is silent at first, her face showing fear at hearing your "cheery" new outlook on life. She does find words eventually, though, "Please don't be like this. I already said I'd take care of you".

"Oh, of course you will", you carry a sadistic giddiness as you address Shyanne's offer, "I'm sure you've already got my cage and feeding dish all picked out! Hey, you think you could lay out some newspaper in the corner so I can go to the bathroom?!"

Shyanne can only wince at your sarcastic tirade before moving on, "I know, I'll give you to your mother".

"Perfect", you don't change your voice at all, "I couldn't get enough of her babying before. I'll just love it now that she can literally control my every move. And I'm sure her incessant need to punish me, you know, to show her little baby whose in charge, will just disappear now that it will be so much easier to do so".

"What about Clarice?", Shyanne sounds confident in her selection.

"Don't you EVER say that bitch's name in front of me again!", you shout in a rage.

Shyanne's free hand grasps you tightly, her tall digits curling around your midsection. Her hand trembles with emotion, reciprocating the effect onto you, as it squeezes with unknowing strength.

"Just stop it, alright?!", Shyanne is near tears, "I'm only trying to help you, so stop yelling at me!".

A loud crack fills the air, followed by pained shrieks from you. Shyanne has just inadvertently cracked at least one of your ribs. Her fingers quickly open flat, laying you out in her guilty hand. Still moaning, you manage to rise to your feet. Shyanne's fingers form a new protective barrier to compensate.

"Stay down!", Shyanne tries to sound authoritative, but her order is sounded in a childlike fashion, "Don't move around".

"Why don't you just fini-", your next morbid statement is cut off by a dizzy feeling.

You look around, and notice everything in sight gain mass and height. Shyanne's dainty fingers seem to expand, now stretching a bit taller than you. Her terrified visage take up even more of the sky than before. The entire experience can only be described as surreal. You can't be more than two inches high.

"I won't do it!", Shyanne shouts, "I won't let you die, Jamie!".

Shyanne's free hand dives into a nearby pocket, digging out a corked test tube containing a bright yellow liquid. She opens the tube and uses the thumb of the hand on which you stand to pull your jaw open. It feels as though she is going to rip it from your face. The vial hovers above you, tilting to unleash its contents onto you. Shyanne pours the serum, a fair portion of it landing in your mouth. She relinquishes her hold on your jaw. All the painful experiences of your rather eventful day culminate into this single moment, and it becomes too much to bare. Your vision goes black, and you pass out. When you come to, you notice that you are...
111111122222212.title: An insane verbal assault

1111111222222121.content:
The plush, impressionable white expanse on which you lay swelters your clothed back. Wait, clothed? Your eyes examine the rest of you in pleasant curiosity as your midsection sorely draws your top half vertical. Ruffled dungarees flow loosely down your legs and over the lips of gray tennis shoes lined in blue. A gangling long sleeve t-shirt of dull argent covers your upper body cozily. You recognize these clothes, but they should be much, much too large for you at your current size. Unless...Did Shyanne's serum cure you somehow?! Could you possibly be back to your old stature?

"I shrank your clothes", Shyanne's voice booms from on high, "I washed them with the shrinking solution. I thought you might get uncomfortable being naked all the time".

In response to this new information, you look around and see that you are still as depressingly tiny as the last time you were conscious. You are on Shyanne's bed, or more accurately one of the pillows atop the grand mattress. Everything looks so...incredible, so daunting. The rust brown bed spread surrounding you spans city blocks from head to foot. An incomparable distance beyond bed's end towers the wide monolith serving as Shyanne's work desk. To your left lays the planing reddish surface of a dresser, complete with an elongated lighthouse illuminating the world through thin white shade.

"You've been out for two days", Shyanne explains, a sadness in her voice, "You were so beat up. I've been taking care of your cuts and bruises, and stuff like that".

Rolling over, your palms push off on a remarkably colder portion of the generic pillowcase. Your arms have difficulty holding your meaningless weight, collapsing as you try to stand. You try again. You fail again. The frustration of your atrophy increases ten fold when your legs barely respond to your request for assistance, though you don't show it. Two forgiving cushions gently close on your sides, rotating you from your invisible horizontal prison and setting you on your feet. You begin to stumble, but a mighty finger nail laced in dark purple digs itself into the ground next to you, giving you a pole of bone and flesh to use as support. Your arms weakly latch themselves around the pillar and you are saved the humiliation of falling flat on your face.

"It might take some time to get the feeling back in your arms and legs", Shyanne attempts to assure, "I tried to move them around a little bit, so they'd be alright if...when you woke up, but I was so afraid I might...break you".

Your knees start to bend on command as your eyes wander past the soft finger you hang from and toward its owner. Shyanne is wearing the same shirt since last you saw her, much raunchier this time. Her dingy hair is knotted and split. Pale skin surrounds bloodshot eyes weighed down with heavy bags of purplish-black. Chapped lips part as Shyanne speaks to you once again.

"Mom and 'trice went to Florida for the week", Shyanne gives effort to sound upbeat, "Spring Break. They thought I was sick, so they let me stay here when I asked. At least we won't have to worry about them for a week".

You stare blankly up at the gargantuan teenager, unsure what to make of this situation.

"Are you hungry?", Shyanne sweetly asks as she tilts her head, "It's kinda late, but you haven't eaten anything for two days. I could carry you to the kitchen...".

You are hungry, but do you really want to accept help from the girl who destroyed your life? Sure, she seems helpful enough, but Shyanne did want to make you her pet. Are you really going to play into that fantasy now? But you're so hungry...
1111111222222121.title: Nursed to health

11111112222221212.content:
A hearty shove away from your balancing appendage accompanies your silence. You under compensate the strength in your arms, however, and subsequently careen backward. Another of Shyanne's saving fingers uncoils from its semi-fisted base above, its nail catching the small of your back before you stumble onto your bottom. The width of the smooth encasing matches that of your waste; pathetic. Pushing off the nail in a fit of rage, you look up at your unwelcome helper with an icy stare, to which only a dejected moue answers. With a sigh, Shyanne removes the hand from her pillow, sending it on a voyage out of view below the nearest contour of her bed. A voluminous whittling harks the opening of a drawer attached to the nearby dresser. Soon after, the hand reemerges within sight carrying a matchbox and oddly cushioned box between prodigious tentacles. Shyanne sets these items in specific order atop the dresser.

"I made you this bed", Shyanne points to the box as she announces its purpose, "The matchbox has a bunch of your clothes in it. I stole them from your house. Hope ya don't mind", she finishes with a weak, hopeful smile.

You ignore Shyanne's lame attempt at humor and take your first step toward the dresser. Your legs are still a bit shaky, but it's the ground itself that gives you the most difficulty. The pillow almost swallows your trainers with each tread, acting as dry quicksand would were it to exist. You press onward, but a flat, opened palm crashes softly before your path.

"You want some help?", Shyanne offers sincerely, "It'd be a lot easier than walking".

You don't bother with words, only careful strides around this newest impediment to your trek. The journey is annoying and tiresome, consuming all of five minutes to complete. With a leap, you clear the small gap separating the pillow from the roughly level dresser surface. You glance back at Shyanne, a silent gloat in your pose at your success without her help. Rather than the spite you expected to find, amazed joy consumes her expression. She stands from her kneeling position, awing you with her true size in the process, and seats herself on the ledge of the bed adjacent to your sanctuary. Her eyes never leave you.

Instead of allowing Shyanne the pleasure of seeing you indulge in her offerings, you lose yourself in the vague gray wall nearest you. It's plain...blank....empty, just like your life now. As you stare in lost thought, images leave your mind and play out on the vacant "movie screen"; you're first day at the college you've been meaning to but will never attend, receiving you're first check from the job which you'll never work, playing with the children you never even knew you wanted until this very moment but will never have. You keep at creating these saddening false memories of times never to come for hours on end, making sure to keep your emotions in check all the while, as you lean against the maroon base of Shyanne's lamp.

Eventually, the corner of your eye catches a glimpse of Shyanne herself, still sitting on the bed and still watching you through exhausted eyes. Doesn't she have anything better to do? She looks so tired, but she refuses to sleep so long as you're awake it seems. You don't feel the slightest bit sleepy, probably due to the fact that you've just awaken from a two day slumber not that long ago, but you really don't like to see Shyanne deprive herself like this. Besides, you're really starting to depress yourself with your pointless daydreaming. Although, you could try to make the most of your new height and cheer yourself up with a little exploration...
11111112222221212.title: Your new "room"

choices: Your capable and willing to go through with this
111111122222212121.content:
After hours of staring at the wall, you've decided that your life isn't worth living anymore.

Your life is in shambles, those willing to take care of you see you only as a pet or someone to be controlled. You have no chance at a real future; going to college, having a family, any of it. If you keep on living the best you could hope for is to live like a hamster.

But you know that Shyanne is watching you to closely to be able to do anything about it, and its not very likely she'll help you out, last time you told her to just finish you off she didn't even listen or let you finish, she just shoved that damn anti-shrinking serum down your throat!!

With that in mind you decide a little deception is in order, you get up (weakly again) and stumble over to your new "bed", you let out a dark chuckle thinking of how far you've fallen, but that wont matter much longer...

Shyanne, seeing what you were doing gives a little smile, thinking that you've finally accepted whats happened to you, and that you will start looking forward now. You crawled into your bed, and after watching you for a short time, she realizes that you probably wont be able to fall asleep with her watching you (to damn creepy), and decides to lay down herself. At first she was only planning on laying down until you were asleep then she was going to shower and change into pajamas. But after days without sleep, she was out almost as soon as her head hit the pillow, not even bothering to turn off the lights.

You wait quite awhile after she disappears to get up, wanting to ensure that you wont be interrupted. You slowly walk to the edge of the dresser and look down, at your extremely small size the drop looks like a massive cliff, or a skyscraper...

"Perfect" you say aloud, sure that jumping from this height will be more then enough to end this hell.

You gather your courage as you prepare to jump

...

After a few moments hesitation, you do it, you take that one. final. step...

Despite your previous apparent immunity to feeling pain, this was way beyond getting scratched in the back, and even beyond the cracking of your ribs, you can't help but think of a quote you heard only a week before... "just when you think you've hit the bottom of the hole, some jackass will throw you a shovel". Unfortunately, this time the jackass was yourself.

You can't move now, all your capable of is rolling around and crying in pain, not sure if you want Shyannes help or if you'd rather just stick it out and die a slow death.

Finally you hear Shyanne starting to wake up, right now your best hope is that she'll get out of bed without looking and crush you under her foot, but you fear because it'd have to crush you entirely (or at least your head) for it to be a quick and relatively painless death, or you could just end up worse then you are now.

Shyanne swings her legs out of bed and puts them right about you the floor as she stretches, but she does not stand up, her feet are hovering only inches from your body. She looks over at your bed and says in a very cheery voice "Good morning Jamie, how are you feeling today!!?"

Waiting a few seconds for a response, she assumes your still sleeping, but after provoking no reaction (not even a rustle of the sheets from you trying to get away from the noise she becomes worried, maybe you were more injured then she thought? Shyanne fearing she knows what happened, looks down and lets out a shriek as she sees you...

Getting into a starting position you gather your energy and resolve, and start the run...

While you were getting ready, Shyanne woke up, she had been having a bad dream about you, that you hated her and always would, thinking of all the terrible things that could happen to you at this size she starts to regret what she did, knowing that it was irreversible, the stress on enlarging your body would be to great, like trying to expand a picture on a computer to much, eventually it looses cohesion and all you have is a blob, the best she could do for you was grow you a little larger, and even that could take months or years to develop.

She has essentially destroyed your whole life for her own selfish reasons, and she was just now really realizing it (she was to concerned for your health for the past couple days to think about it). While she was realizing this she looked over at your bed, expecting to see you sleeping soundly.

She gasped when she saw you by the lamp, positioned like you were going to start a race. Her fear gripped a hold of her as she realized what you were probably doing... She bolted up from her bed right as you start your dash.

"Jamie NO! STOP!" she shrieked, but even in your surprise of her sudden outburst (you still thought she was alseep) you would not be deterred, you were to close!!

She first asked you to follow her.She walked over to a door opened it and went down it to her basement and you followed her.She flipped on the light and you saw that It was a large room with some cardboard boxes piled up in the middle.You helped her move the boxes to a closet under the basement stairs.
